actions.committee: House Committee on Foreign Affairs (Subsequently: International Relations)
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Foreign Affairs (Subsequently: International Relations).

official_title: Resolution directing the President of the United States to provide information, and answer certain questions, relating to American policy toward Chile between 1964 and 1973.

summary.text: Directs the President of the United States to furnish to the Committee on Foreign Affairs of the House of Representatives, within ten days, specified information with regard to United States policy toward Chile on the following: (1) total aid to Allende opponents,; (2) existence of an interagency policy group; (3) economic sanctions against Chile; (4) the policy of United States banks towards Chile; (5) the policy of United States banks towards Chile; (5) the policy of multilateral financial institutions, such as the Export-Import Bank; (6) economic policy documents; (7) assistance provided by United States Corporations; (8) assistance provided by foreign corporations; and (9) the National Security Council-Forty Committee decisions. Directs the President of the United States to furnish to the Committee on Foreign Affairs of the House of Representatives, within ten days, specified information with regard to: (1) aid to the national party; (2) aid to patria Y. libertad; (3) aid to Chistian Democratic Party; (4) aid to striking shopkeepers and professionals; (5) the 1973 truckers strike; (6) the Chilean industrial association; (7) payments to Protexa/Grupo Mendoza; (8) payments to El Mercurio; (9) participation of Central Intelligence Agency personnel in the coup; and (10) the factual basis for the statement of President Ford on September 16, 1974.

titles.title: Resolution directing the President of the United States to provide information, and answer certain questions, relating to American policy toward Chile between 1964 and 1973.
